message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.CC, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with computational geometry problems, specifically the problem of finding the simplex of largest volume in the convex hull of points and the problem of finding the largest absolute value of a subdeterminant of a matrix. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves approximation algorithms and hardness results, which are common topics in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). The use of logarithmic factors suggests a connection to cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and the study of inapproximability. Finally, the problem of finding the largest subdeterminant of a matrix is related to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and the study of determinants and matrices.
